mainText: Congratulations to staff and people being supported by our Dumfries and Galloway service for raising money to buy a Dermlite machine for Castle Douglas Health Centre. This machine will allow GPs to diagnose melanoma and other skin cancers at a surgery appointment. Having this service locally means that people won't have to travel into Dumfries for initial diagnosis, reducing the distance and logistics of travelling.

T.P.S. Connects is a community of people that have used Turning Point Scotland's services. It was set up to give people a chance to socialise, actively participate in planning activities and events, and to have their voices heard. Anyone that has used our services can can take part and enjoy a range of conferences, events, sport and music groups in a safe and welcoming environment. This year, T.P.S. Connects surpassed 300 members. To highlight the work of T.P.S. Connects, we've created a short animated video and a podcast discussing the group. Go to our youtube page to watch the video or search for Talking Points wherever you get your podcasts to find out more.

Since it was set up in 2003, our 2-1-8 service has been hugely influencial in the development of more effective alternatives to custody for women in the justice system. Our latest video explains more about the service and how it works. Check it out on our YouTube channel.
